text: Hori I, son of Kama, was Viceroy of Kush under Siptah and is attested in year 6 of that king. He likely continued to serve under Setnakhte, and Ramesses III. Hori's titles include: King's Son of Kush, First charioteer of His Majesty, and King's messenger to every land. The Viceroys of Ethiopia (II) by George A. Reisner The Journal of Egyptian Archaeology, Vol. 6, No. 1. (Jan., 1920) Hori I was succeeded by his son who was also called Hori. Hori's tomb was found in Tell Basta.Labib Habachi, Tell Basta, Supplement aux Annales du Service des Antiquitks de l'Egypte. Cahier no. 22. ==References== Category:12th-century BC Egyptian people Category:Viceroys of Kush Category:Twentieth Dynasty of Egypt Category:Nineteenth Dynasty of Egypt
title: Hori I (Viceroy of Kush)
